<Text: Extensibility:  The term extensibility can also be seen as a systemic measure of the ability to extend a system and the level of effort required to implement the extension.>

Text: Extensibility:  Extensions can be through the addition of new functionality or through modification of existing functionality.
Triplets:<Extensions
4:
--------------------
Text: Extensibility:  An extensible system is one whose internal structure and data flow are minimally or not affected by new or modified functionality, for example recompiling or changing the original source code might be unnecessary when changing a system’s behavior, either by the creator or other programmers.
Triplets:<Extensibility
